content.question: Which of the following best explains the trend in the data between 2000 and 2005 ?

choices.label: Mexicans’ support for democracy peaked in 2002 as the country began to recover from the peso crisis and depression of the late 1990s.
Mexicans’ support for democracy collapsed in 2002 as opposition parties questioned the legitimacy of the elections of 2000.
Mexicans’ support for democracy collapsed in 2002 as scandals regarding connections between leaders of drug cartels and politicians discredited the ruling party.
Mexicans’ support for democracy peaked in 2002 soon after the PRI finally proved vulnerable to electoral loss and Mexicans became enthusiastic about the possibilities for change.

content.answer: Mexicans’ support for democracy peaked in 2002 soon after the PRI finally proved vulnerable to electoral loss and Mexicans became enthusiastic about the possibilities for change.
